description: Encourages pretend play and imagination.
parent_instruction: Demonstrate how the materials (stickers, paper) create an outcome—rolling, bouncing, dropping, sticking. Invite your toddler to try and observe what happens. Ask questions like 'What do you think will happen if you try this?' Celebrate discoveries and encourage experiments.

description: Supports fine motor development through manipulation.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: bottles, rice, beans. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: A fun hands-on activity encouraging exploration.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: water, brush. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Kids practice coordination and movement.
parent_instruction: Place felt shapes on a table. Demonstrate the small-hand movements needed—pinching, threading, placing, squeezing. Let your toddler try at their own pace. Encourage slow, intentional movements and celebrate each attempt. Offer help only when necessary to avoid frustration.

description: Supports fine motor development through manipulation.
parent_instruction: Set out yarn, cardboard within reach. Show the basic action once, then invite your toddler to explore. Follow their lead—support when needed, step back when they’re confident. Talk with them about what they are doing to build language and connection.

description: Encourages pretend play and imagination.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: rice, containers, scoops. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Kids practice coordination and movement.
parent_instruction: Place chalk on a table. Demonstrate the small-hand movements needed—pinching, threading, placing, squeezing. Let your toddler try at their own pace. Encourage slow, intentional movements and celebrate each attempt. Offer help only when necessary to avoid frustration.

description: Supports fine motor development through manipulation.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: bottles, rice, beans. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Supports fine motor development through manipulation.
parent_instruction: Set out paint, brushes on a protected surface. Show a simple artistic step—pressing paint, rubbing crayons, sticking shapes. Encourage your toddler to experiment freely. Avoid correcting their choices; focus on the process. Talk about colors, lines, and shapes they create.

description: Encourages pretend play and imagination.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: cups, pitchers, water. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

parent_instruction: Place paint, brushes on a table. Demonstrate the small-hand movements needed—pinching, threading, placing, squeezing. Let your toddler try at their own pace. Encourage slow, intentional movements and celebrate each attempt. Offer help only when necessary to avoid frustration.

description: Helps toddlers explore textures and colors.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: balls, ramp. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: A fun hands-on activity encouraging exploration.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: rice, containers, scoops. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Kids practice coordination and movement.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: rice, containers, scoops. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Toddlers engage in creative, open-ended play.
parent_instruction: Create a safe open space. Introduce the materials: bubbles. Show the big movement first—rolling, tossing, climbing, chasing. Invite your toddler to copy you. Allow them to repeat movements many times. Be close by for safety while encouraging free movement.

description: Encourages pretend play and imagination.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: water, brush. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Encourages pretend play and imagination.
parent_instruction: Set out pom-poms, bowls, tongs within reach. Show the basic action once, then invite your toddler to explore. Follow their lead—support when needed, step back when they’re confident. Talk with them about what they are doing to build language and connection.

description: Kids practice coordination and movement.
parent_instruction: Demonstrate how the materials (felt shapes) create an outcome—rolling, bouncing, dropping, sticking. Invite your toddler to try and observe what happens. Ask questions like 'What do you think will happen if you try this?' Celebrate discoveries and encourage experiments.

description: A fun hands-on activity encouraging exploration.
parent_instruction: Set out play dough within reach. Show the basic action once, then invite your toddler to explore. Follow their lead—support when needed, step back when they’re confident. Talk with them about what they are doing to build language and connection.

description: Helps toddlers explore textures and colors.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: pom-poms, bowls, tongs. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: A calm activity that promotes focus.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: rice, containers, scoops. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: A simple sensory activity for curiosity and discovery.
parent_instruction: Set out stickers, paper within reach. Show the basic action once, then invite your toddler to explore. Follow their lead—support when needed, step back when they’re confident. Talk with them about what they are doing to build language and connection.

description: A fun hands-on activity encouraging exploration.
parent_instruction: Spread out nature items in small groups. Show your toddler how to sort by color, shape, or size. Encourage them to place items into matching piles or containers. Offer simple prompts like 'Can you find another one like this?' Keep the atmosphere playful and low-pressure.

parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: sponges, water, tray. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Helps children build confidence through self-directed play.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: bird seed, scoops. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: A calming activity that increases focus.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: cotton balls, tongs. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Encourages imagination through tactile play.
parent_instruction: Set out feathers, glue within reach. Show the basic action once, then invite your toddler to explore. Follow their lead—support when needed, step back when they’re confident. Talk with them about what they are doing to build language and connection.

description: Encourages imagination through tactile play.
parent_instruction: Set out fabric scraps within reach. Show the basic action once, then invite your toddler to explore. Follow their lead—support when needed, step back when they’re confident. Talk with them about what they are doing to build language and connection.

description: A hands-on exploration that builds motor skills.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: feathers, glue. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: A calming activity that increases focus.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: sponges, water, tray. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Helps children build confidence through self-directed play.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: pots, wooden spoons. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: Supports early learning through guided interaction.
parent_instruction: Create a safe open space. Introduce the materials: buttons, cups. Show the big movement first—rolling, tossing, climbing, chasing. Invite your toddler to copy you. Allow them to repeat movements many times. Be close by for safety while encouraging free movement.

description: Toddlers explore new textures and actions safely.
parent_instruction: Prepare a shallow bin and pour in the materials: bird seed, scoops. Show your toddler how to touch, scoop, squeeze, or pour. Encourage them to explore textures and sounds. Talk about how it feels—soft, rough, warm, cool. Stay close to ensure items stay in the play area.

description: A hands-on exploration that builds motor skills.
parent_instruction: Set out paper tubes, cars on a protected surface. Show a simple artistic step—pressing paint, rubbing crayons, sticking shapes. Encourage your toddler to experiment freely. Avoid correcting their choices; focus on the process. Talk about colors, lines, and shapes they create.

description: A calming activity that increases focus.
parent_instruction: Place buttons, cups on a table. Demonstrate the small-hand movements needed—pinching, threading, placing, squeezing. Let your toddler try at their own pace. Encourage slow, intentional movements and celebrate each attempt. Offer help only when necessary to avoid frustration.

description: Encourages imagination through tactile play.
parent_instruction: Place buttons, cups on a table. Demonstrate the small-hand movements needed—pinching, threading, placing, squeezing. Let your toddler try at their own pace. Encourage slow, intentional movements and celebrate each attempt. Offer help only when necessary to avoid frustration.

description: Promotes creativity while strengthening coordination.
parent_instruction: Demonstrate how the materials (pots, wooden spoons) create an outcome—rolling, bouncing, dropping, sticking. Invite your toddler to try and observe what happens. Ask questions like 'What do you think will happen if you try this?' Celebrate discoveries and encourage experiments.

description: Promotes creativity while strengthening coordination.
parent_instruction: Spread out flashcards in small groups. Show your toddler how to sort by color, shape, or size. Encourage them to place items into matching piles or containers. Offer simple prompts like 'Can you find another one like this?' Keep the atmosphere playful and low-pressure.

description: A calming activity that increases focus.
parent_instruction: Demonstrate how the materials (foam letters) create an outcome—rolling, bouncing, dropping, sticking. Invite your toddler to try and observe what happens. Ask questions like 'What do you think will happen if you try this?' Celebrate discoveries and encourage experiments.

description: A hands-on exploration that builds motor skills.
parent_instruction: Set out large beads, string within reach. Show the basic action once, then invite your toddler to explore. Follow their lead—support when needed, step back when they’re confident. Talk with them about what they are doing to build language and connection.
